reviewText: Great movie when I first saw it many years ago.  Still a great movie.  Newman at his best.  Youngers watchers may find the premise dated, but true movie nuts like me will put the film in its historical context.

reviewText: Excellent,gritty cop movie.Reminds me of the real NYC i grew up in. Paul Newman shines in this movie as well as the supporting cast. From the opening scene of the hooker and cops straight through to the dramatic finish this movie will keep you on the edge of your seat. The entire movie was filmed on location and you get some scenes of the Bronx when it literaly was burning back in the 1970s.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Picked this up for my son-in-law who could'nt find it (for free?), and although the cast is top notch(NEWMAN, AIELLO, ASNER), they are here for the rent-money. As a lifetime denizen of the Bronx, rest assured, that if the transgressions perpetrated on these cops by the miscreants in this movie were real, the response would have been a deafening volley of gunfire. NYPD DON'T PLAY DAT CRAP!

reviewText: I was a little girl when I saw this movie in the theather, I am a big Paul Newman fan anyway and love his movies but to me this is one of his best. I love the grittiness of this movie. the action is great especially since i usually don't watch these type of movies. This movie is recommended if you want to watch something about how grimmy SOME parts of the Bronx New York and the police can be.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Those of you who are not so familiar with the history of New York, the borough of Bronx in the 1980's looked like a war zone, add to that poverty, crime, spreading crack epidemic, birth of graffiti and hip-hop and you got yourself the New York you saw in the movies growing up.  Till this very day the image of the 1970's and 1980's Bronx stands as a memorial to American fundamental image of dangerous-coolness.This is a not-so typical police drama starting aging Paul Newman who together with his younger partner patrol the streets of south Bronx, fighting crime and injustice, while at the same time trying to cope with their personal lives.  This must be must be in my opinion Neman's last awesome performance as an actor.  Totally recommended for the fans of Antoine Fuqua.

reviewText: By all the other reviews I read.Their is a lot of demand for this film to be put out on BD.This was the last great Paul Newman film.So Why doesn't Warner Bros get with it and put this film out on Blu-Ray.This was originally a HBO movie.It was originally brought to DVD with a so so Non anamorphic DVD transfer.You'd think that WB would give this film a good anamorphic DVD/BD transfer/but enested they release that lame Full frame DVD of the film.And I agree with the customer who says it's a horrible transfer.Get with it Warner Bros.!!!!!!!This film deserves so much better.!!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: FORT APACHE, THE BRONX is a 2-hour color movie taking place in the Bronx, one of the seven boroughs of New York City.  The Bronx is the borough that is contiguous with, and just to the north of, Manhattan.  The film takes place in various locations, including a police station, the street immediately in front of the police station, places of residence of various sleazy characters, on various rooftops, and in a hospital.  The characters include Paul Newman (older) and Ken Wahl (younger), who are partners on the police force who share a squad car.  Wahl is handsome and has long hair.  Often the pair engage in their rounds in street clothes. The characters also include Newman's love interest, Rachel Ticotin, who plays the part of a nurse in the hospital, Edward Asner, who is the police captain, and Pam Grier, who plays a hooker.VIOLENCE AND OTHER EXTREME SCENES.  If you prefer mild-mannered movies, such as ELLA ENCHANTED, or 13 GOING ON 33, then  this film might not be the best choice for you.  At the beginning, Pam Grier shoots two cops, point-blank, and we see the bulletholes in their heads.  Near the beginning, a transvestite goes nuts and threatens to jump off of a building, and he actually does fall off, but Newman and Wahl catch him by his heels just in time.  Later on, Pam Grier slashes a john with a razor blade.  At a later point, two policemen throw a Puerto Rican off of a rooftop, during a neighborhood riot.  Toward the end of the movie, Pam Grier is killed in an apartment, and she is rolled up in the livingroom rug, and tossed in a heap of neighborhood garbage.  Aside from the violence, the film contains various stunts, such as a scene near the end when Newman and Wahl rappel down the outside of the building.  There is also an interesting scene, where Newman and Wahl bring a garbage can into the hallway of an apartment, set if afire, and call, "FIIIIIRE!"  The result is that they successfully smoke out the residents in one of the flats.  Yet another scene, is where Newman coaches a 14 year old girl through a delivery, in her family's apartment.  Shortly thereafter, Newman confides with his partner that he has delivered around 15 babies, during his tenure on the police force.CONTRADICTIONS.  This film does an excellent job at disclosing various contradictions, that so characterize what is known as "the human condition."  The simplest one to describe, is the following.  After Newman makes friends with Ticotin, he notices that she has needle marks on her leg, and he realizes that she has taken heroin.  However, Newman likes Ticotin, andhe says nothing at first.  But a bit later on in the movie, he confronts her use of heroin, and she responds with denials.  Despite the fact that both of them understand that she takes heroin, and despite Newman's understanding that taking heroin is a crime, they continue to accept each other as boyfriend and girlfriend.  Another contradiction is the fact that Newman and Wahl have witnessed two other members of the force toss a Puerto Rican off of a building (they witnessed a murder), Newman and Wahl decide to live in silence with this knowledge.  This is another sort of contradiction, which gets resolved at the very end of the movie.  Yet another form of contradiction, is Asner's behavior in strictly enforcing the law, where the consequence is a neighborhood riot and escalating violence.  In other words, the contradiction is that seasoned members of the force, such as Newman, know that it is not the best thing to crack down on petty crime, while Asner's approach is to haul in every person who engages even in a minor crime.THE PLOT.  The main plot gets off the ground at the start of the picture, when Pam Grier (the hooker) shoots two policemen point blank as they sit in their squad car.  Asner's response, is to order the force to get tough on the neighborhood, and to bring all persons who have committed even the slightest offense in for questioning, as to who is the cop-killer.  The viewer will enjoy seeing some close calls, when Newman and Wahl interview Pam Grier's pimp (dressed in a white fur coat), while Pam Grier lingers nearby in the wide open.  Later on, the viewer will enjoy seeing Newman and Wahl capture about 50 hookers and their johns, and herding them into a municipal bus, while the viewer sees Pam Grier slip off unnoticed down a side street.  Eventually, as mentioned above, Pam Grier is killed, rolled up into a livingroom carpet, and abandoned in one of the many neighborhood junk piles that so characterized the Bronx.CONCLUSION.  If you relished the lite-drama of DOG DAY AFTERNOON, or if you enjoyed that warm-and-fuzzy-feeling from SILENCE OF THE LAMBS, then FORT APACHE, THE BRONX will be just right for you!  The ending of this movie is actually quite clever.  The conclusion features a couple of unexpected about-faces in the plot, resulting in a happy ending.  But the conclusion also includes a tragedy.  There are about a dozen films that I have watched many times, over and over.  I don't think that anybody will want to watch FORT APACHE, THE BRONX more than once, unless one is a student of acting or cinematography.  FIVE STARS.
summary: Two hours of adventure in the Bronx borough of New York City
